message.content:
cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.FL, cs.LO, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with a problem related to number theory and combinatorics, specifically the representation of natural numbers as sums of palindromes in different bases. This suggests that the paper may belong to the Discrete Mathematics (cs.DM) category. The use of automata as a decision procedure is a key aspect of the paper, indicating that it may also be relevant to the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) and Formal Languages and Automata Theory (cs.FL) categories. The paper also involves some logical reasoning and proof techniques, which could place it in the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) category. Finally, the problem of representing numbers as sums of palindromes has connections to graph theory and combinatorial optimization, which could make the paper relevant to the Graph Theory (cs.GT) category.
